author: Aqsa Younas Rana
title: Institut Al-Quran Darul Aman Celebrates 51 Graduates in 37th Convocation
text:
The Institut Al-Quran Darul Aman (Iqdar) in Alor Setar, Malaysia, has been acknowledged as one of the nation's leading
tahfiz institutions. This recognition has significantly enhanced its reputation, drawing numerous students to apply.
Iqdar recently celebrated a significant milestone with its 37th
convocation ceremony, held at the Dewan Konvokesyen Universiti Antarabangsa Albukhary in Alor Setar. The event marked the graduation of 51 students, highlighting the institution's commitment to producing qualified huffaz.
Kadri Abdul Hamid, Chief Operating Officer of Iqdar, emphasized the institution's success, stating, *"The recognition has shown that Iqdar's success in producing huffaz is on par with other top tahfiz institutions in Malaysia. "* His statement highlights the high standards and quality of education provided by Iqdar.
The convocation also saw 28 students from Iqdar successfully obtaining
teaching certifications in Kedah, further demonstrating the institution's role in promoting educational excellence. This achievement not only benefits the graduates but also contributes to the broader community by enhancing the quality of Islamic education.
Why this matters: The recognition of Iqdar as a top tahfiz institution has significant implications for the education sector in Malaysia, particularly in the field of Islamic education. This achievement is likely to have a positive impact on the community, contributing to the development of well-qualified huffaz and Islamic educators.
Datuk Siti Aishah Ghazali, Exco for Rural Development, Human Development, and Poverty Eradication in Kedah, highlighted the institution's potential, stating, "The institution is capable of building a brighter future." Her remarks reflect the optimistic outlook for Iqdar's role in shaping the future of its students and the community.
The Kedah Islamic Foundation (Yayasan Islam Negeri Kedah) and the state government have pledged continued collaboration with Iqdar. This partnership aims to provide the best platform for educating the community, particularly students, to appreciate and understand the
Quran.
The recognition of Iqdar as a top tahfiz institution and its recent achievements highlight its significant role in the educational sector of Malaysia. With a growing number of students applying and its commitment to excellence, Iqdar is set to continue its success in the years to come.
Key Takeaways
- Iqdar recognized as one of Malaysia's top tahfiz institutions.
- 51 students graduated in Iqdar's 37th convocation ceremony.
- 28 students obtained teaching certifications in Kedah.
- Iqdar's recognition to positively impact Islamic education in Malaysia.
- Kedah government and Islamic Foundation to collaborate with Iqdar.
